gurmukhi: ਚਿਬਕ ਚਾਰ ਸੁਧਾਰ ਡਾਰ ਕਾਜਰ ਨੈਨ ॥ ਜੀਵ ਜੰਤਨ ਕਾ ਚਲੀ ਚਿਤ ਲੇਤ ਚੋਰ ਸਮੈਨ ॥
transliteration: Chibak Chaar Sudhaar Besar Daar Kaajar Nain|| Jeev Jantan Kaa Chalichit Let Chor Samain||
translation: They had pretty cheeks, there was antimony in their eyes and rings in their noses; they were stealing the hearts of all like the thieves,

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖ ਰੀ ਸੁ ਕੁਮਾਰ ਸੁੰਦਰ ਅਾਜੁ ਬਰ ਹੈ ਬੀਰ ॥ ਬੀਨ ਬੀਨ ਧਰੋ ਸਬੰਗਨ ਸੁੱਧ ਕੇਸਰ ਚੀਰ ॥
transliteration: Dekh Risu Koumaar Soundar Aaj(u) Bar Hai Beer|| Been Been Ddaro Sabanad Suddh Kesar Cheer||
translation: And were conversing with one another regarding the application of saffron to the limbs, because the handsome princess was to be wedded on that day;

gurmukhi: ਚੀਨ ਚੀਨ ਬਰਿ ਹੈ ਸੁਬਾਹ ਸੁ ਮੱਧ ਜੁੱਧ ੳੁਛਾਹ ॥ ਤੇਗ ਤੀਰਨ ਬਾਨ ਬਰਛਨ ਜੀਤ ਕਰਿ ਹੈ ਬਯਾਹ ॥੩੯॥੧੧੩॥
transliteration: Cheen Cheen Bar(i) Hai Soubaah Su Maddh Juddh Ouchhaad|| Teg Tderan Baan Barchhan Jeet Kar(i) Hai Byaah||39||113||
translation: The enthusiastic heavenly damsels were picking up those warriors in the war-arena who were being conquered with swords, arrows, bows, lances etc. and were marrying those fine fighters.39.113.

gurmukhi: ਕਹ ਲੌ ੳੁਪਮਾ ੲਿਤੀ ਕਰੌ ॥ ਗ੍ਰੰਥ ਬਢਨ ਕੇ ਕਾਜ ਸੁਨਹੁ ਜੂ ਚਿਤ ਮੈ ਅਧਿਕ ਡਰੌ ॥
transliteration: Kah Lau Oupmaa Itikaraoun|| Granth Badhan Ke Kaaj Sounauh Joo Chit Mai Adhik Daraoun||
translation: To what extent should I describe it, because I fear the book will become voluminous,

gurmukhi: ਤੳੂ ਸੁਧਾਰ ਬਿਚਾਰ ਕਥਾ ਕਹਿ ਕਹਿ ਸੰਛੇਪ ਬਖਾਨੋ ॥ ਜੈਸੇ ਤਵ ਪ੍ਰਤਾਪ ਕੇ ਬਲ ਤੇ ਜਥਾ ਸ਼ਕਤਿ ਅਨਮਾਨੋ ॥
transliteration: Taoo Sudhaar Bichaar Kathaa Kah(i) Kah(i) Sanchhep Bakhaano|| Jaiso Tav Prataap Ke Bal Te Jathaa Shakat(i) Anmaano||
translation: Therefore I am improving thoughtfully the story and describing it in brief; I hope that with the strength of your wisdom, you will assess it accordingly;

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਪਾਰਸ ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧ ਰਨ ਮੰਡਯੋ ਨਾਨਾ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਚਲਾੲੇ ॥ ਹਤੇ ਸੁ ਹਤੇ ਜੀਅ ਲੈ ਭਾਜੇ ਚਹੁਦਿਸ ਗੲੇ ਪਰਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Jab Paaras Eh Bidh Ran Mandyo Naanaa Shastra Chadhaae|| Hate Su Hate Jeea Lai Bhaaje Chahudis Gad Paraae||
translation: When Parasnath waged war in this way, using various types of weapons, then those who were killed were killed, but some of them saved their lives running away in al the four directions;

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਹਠ ਤਿਅਾਗ ਅਾਨ ਪਗ ਲਾਗੇ ਤੇ ਸਭ ਲੲੇ ਬਚਾੲੀ ॥ ਭੂਖਨ ਬਸਨ ਬਹੁਤੁ ਬਿਧਿ ਦੀਨੇ ਦੈ ਦੈ ਬਹੁਤ ਬਡਾੲੀ ॥੪੦॥੧੧੪॥
transliteration: Je Hath Tiaag Aan Pag Laage Te Sabh Lae Bachaaee|| Bhookhan Basan Bahout(u) Bidh(i) Deene Dai Dai Bahout Badaaee||
translation: Those who abandoned their persistence and clung to the feet of the king, they were saved; they were given ornaments, garments etc., and were greatly appreciated in many ways.40.114.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸ ਨਾਥ ਬਡੋ ਰਣ ਪਾਰਯੋ ॥ ਅਾਪਨ ਪ੍ਰਚੁਰ ਜਗਤ ਮਤੁ ਕੀਨਾ ਦੇਵ ਦੱਤ ਕੋ ਟਾਰਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Paaras Naath Bado Ran Pdaryo|| Aapan Prachur Jagad Mat(u) Keedaa Dev Datt Ko Tdaryo||
translation: Parasnath fought a dreadful war and removing the sect of Dutt, he propagated extensively his own sect;

gurmukhi: ਲੈ ਲੈ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਨਾ ਬਿਧਿ ਭਾਂਤ ਅਨਿਕ ਅਰਿ ਮਾਰੇ ॥ ਜੀਤੇ ਪਰਮ ਪੁਰਖ ਪਾਰਸ ਕੇ ਸਗਲ ਜਟਾ ਧਰ ਹਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Lai Lai Shastra Astra Naanaa Bidh(i) Bhaant Anik Ar(i) Mdare|| Jeete Param Purakh Paaras Ke Sagad Jataa Dhar Hdare||
translation: He killed many enemies in various ways with his arms and weapons; in the battle all the warriors of Parasnath were victorious and all those with matted locks were defeated;

gurmukhi: ਬੇਖ ਬੇਖ ਭਟ ਪਰੇ ਧਰਨ ਗਿਰ ਬਾਨ ਪ੍ਰਯੋਘਨ ਘਾੲੇ ॥ ਜਾਨੁਕ ਪਰਮ ਲੋਕ ਪਾਵਨ ਕਹੁ ਪ੍ਰਾਨਨ ਪੰਖ ਲਗਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Bekh Bekh Bhat Dare Dharan Gir Baan Prayoghan Ghaae|| Jaanouk Param Lok Paavan Kauh Praanan Pankh Lagade||
translation: With the infliction of arrows, the warriors wearing many garbs fell down upon the earth; it appeared that they were preparing themselves to fly to the Supreme world attaching wings to their bodies;

gurmukhi: ਟੂਕ ਟੂਕ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਗਿਰੇ ਕਵਚ ਕਟ ਪਰਮ ਪ੍ਰਭਾ ਕਹੁ ਪਾੲੀ ॥ ਜਣੁ ਦੈ ਚਲੈ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਣ ਸੁਰਗ ਕਹ ਕੁਲਹਿ ਕਲੰਕ ਮਿਟਾੲੀ ॥੪੧॥੧੧੫॥
transliteration: Took Took Hvai Gire Kavach Kat Param Prabhaa Kauh Paaee|| Jan(u) Dai Chalai Nishaan Surag Kah Kulah(i) Kalank Mitaaee||41||115||
translation: The supremely impressive armours were torn into fragments and caused to fall down; it appeared that the warriors were leaving the mark of blemish of their clan on the earth and moving towards heaven.41.115.
